Race.SpecificTitle: Brownsfield FPD No. 3 -- 5 Mill - Metropolitan Council - 5 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
BROWNSFIELD FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 3 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  CONTINUATION OF A FIVE (5) MILL PROPERTY TAX FOR A PERIOD OF TEN (10) YEARS TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR DEVELOPING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING THE FIRE PROTECTION FACILITIES OF THE BROWNSFIELD FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 3 WITHIN THE PARISH OF EAST BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA.
Race.FullText: Shall the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1501 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to continue the levy and collection, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of five (5) mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $75,350 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2009 to and including the year 2018, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Tax, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Pride FPD No. 8 -- 10 Mill - Metropolitan Council - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
PRIDE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 8 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  LEVY AND COLLECTION OF A TEN (10) MILL PROPERTY TAX FOR A PERIOD OF TEN (10) YEARS TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR DEVELOPING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING THE FIRE PROTECTION FACILITIES OF THE PRIDE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT NO. 8 WITHIN THE PARISH OF EAST BATON ROUGE, LOUISIANA.
Race.FullText: Shall the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1501 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of ten (10) mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $125,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2008 to and including the year 2017, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Tax, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?
